ratings.comment: In lecture, he did a ton of proofs and a few examples, but he rarely did anything close to the stuff on the exams. To do well on the exams, you needed to be able to *really* apply the concepts. Textbook was OK, but mostly unrelated to exams. This course prerequires only Calc 1; I took 2 and 3, and I still only got a B in 240.

You can't understand anything he says ever. He doesn't know how to talk loudly and has a really thick accent. Eventually I just stopped showing up because I found wikipedia more helpful. The class was easy enough though. This class does a good job at weeding out people who want to do CS but are bad at math.

Speaks too quietly to understand, his handwriting is illegible, and he consistently ignores questions. His course website is riddled with MAJOR inconsistencies (his own name is misspelled). The textbook, lectures, and homework are completely unrelated. The exam hints he gave were misleading at best. I have never learned less from a professor.

True. Math 240 is not easy class. I know. But this class was something that cannot be described by easy or hard. You have to know basic math very well or you will get C or lower. Honestly, homework, exam, and lecture have no relations. Even you read and solve questions from book, you may not be able to solve exams questions. Nothing can help you.

Avoid this professor at all costs.  What he teaches us in lecture is nowhere near the homework or tests.  He's a very knowledgeable and funny man, but his teaching style is nonexistent. I'll be lucky if I finish this course with a C.

Agree with all said below. I practically live in a TA's office and it's easy to pick up that he doesn't agree with teaching methods of Flores. After receiving my test and scanning the questions I reverted to the front page to double-check that it was for our course.

Calculus 2 was easier then this course with Mr. Flores and I've spent twice as much time compared to calc 2 which I thought would be impossible. His  teaching, homework, and tests have no correlation what-so-ever. Homeworks are impossible and the 2nd test was mostly proofs which he clearly stated would not be on the test.

Seems genuinely knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the topic, but really struggled teaching it. Course had no structure, there was almost no connection between lecture and homework/tests. Mostly had to teach myself from the textbook.

Manuel is not a bad professor, but he's not excellent. Most of his explanations I could follow, which isn't bad considering the difficulty of the course content. The course had very poor structure, and most of the homeworks were VERY hard. Math 240 is a horrible course no matter who you have, unfortunately Flores is no exception.

A smart man but he doesn't teach the material that is on the exams. Goes through proofs of the equations but not how the equations are relevant to the class. Not the most clear speaker but it's hard to blame him for not being from the US.

Impossible to understand or hear. His lectures do not prepare you for exams or homework. The textbook does not prepare you for exams or homework. Nothing lines up with anything. Avoid this professor at all costs!

Mr Flores seems to be an extremely intelligent man; however, his broken english, tendency to mumble important facts, and the overall disparity between the material/quizes/exams make this class ( already a difficult subject ) more difficult than it should be.
